name: Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?!
description: Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?! is a wacky simulation game where you manage your very own weapon shop and expand its business across an incredible potato world.Use your potato smiths to forge weapons and sell them to questing heroes.
minimum_requirements: 最低配備: 作業系統: XP / Vista / 7 處理器: Intel 2 GHz 記憶體: 2 GB 記憶體 顯示卡: 1280 x 720 Minimum Resolution DirectX: 版本：9.0 儲存空間: 3 GB 可用空間

reviews.review_text: I do love me some management games. Why not try out one that revolves around running a weapon shop in a fantasy setting full of heroes to do quests? Well, the short answer as to why not to do just that is that this particular roll in that pile of hay is incredibly shallow and lacking in any real features, also the hay isn't actually hay, it's cheap immitation plastic hay thus covering you in horrible scrapes and injuries, like astro turf. This game, which I can't be bothered to type it's name out in full due to it being a bit of nuisance, is a rather simple management game as management games go. Never once did I find myself struggling or having made a failure of an item. I'm either the best player of this game to grace it's face, or it's not that difficult. While I take no issue with this, you more or less see everything this game has to offer in the first 30 minutes, then it expects you to continue to play for several hours to come. It's incredibly easy to earn money to keep up on the payments you have to make, especially as they're story based once you've hit certain reknown levels which can only be attained through repeated selling of items, and thus when the CRIPPLING payments roll around, they're instantly sold out as simple as passing gas. The writing is also something that I can see some peopel enjoying, it's a plethora of pop culture references, but Christ alive, it's grating as heck for me. Forced and rather strained Half-Life 3 references that left me literally howling with laughter, with 'literally' having that new modern meaning of not at all literally. Overall, it's simplicity works in its favour at times as it's a simple, easy game that you can just mindlessly burn your way through with little to no higher brain function required, put on a podcast, drink a bottle of gin and weapon smith your woes and sorrows away. Otherwise, I wouldn't suggest it, unless you've got nothing better to do and a bottle of gin... and maybe some sorrows to forget. (More  HERE  [mozillogames.tumblr.com] )

No, thank you.  A small game that is all grind. Some have said that the game is linear and doesn't present you with any choices. I would say that the game gives you choices, but there are no wrong ones. I played for a long time, hoping that it would improve once I unlocked some more workers and such. It didn't. This feels like going to a job, and not in a fun fantasy way.

Honestly it's a great game, but could surely use improvement. The DLC is cheap - Which is good but nontheless its pretty challenging and its not an easy win, I like that. It gets repetitive after unlocking all stations but still with only 2.9 hours playtime, maybe I haven't seen the good in it. HOLY POTATOES THE POTATO PUNS. I love puns, bad puns, terrible jokes, all of it its just great to me with a cartoony design, the wiggly arms, and bad puns? You can't go wrong.  Pros - Addicting for a few hours - Potato puns - Wiggly arms - Cartoonish style - Good DLC  Cons - Repetitive - Lacks content once high level  Not much else but I'd give a positive review.

I wanted to like it, I truly did.   In my honest opinion, 'Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?!' is merely another Game Dev Tycoon style game but mainly exists for fan service. Having been from many of Kairosoft's IOS games I would've expected more from a game of this price. But again, it is merely fan service. Although the game has funny dialouge, references to real people, games, movies, etc, gameplay seems to be no different other than the fact that you can sell your weapon from a randomly generated number of bids depending on how fitting your weapon is to the buyer.  Again, I wanted to like this game, but at this price I would wait until a sale on this game popped up (if ever).

Fun game with humorous dialogue and lovable artwork. I actually laugh at some of the things written in the game, which I did not expect to.   It may start out slow at first, but give it an hour, and the different layers to the gameplay start to emerge.
Peelers at the ready in this Blacksmithing RPG!

A great casual game. Sountrack is simply amazing. Don't expect much depth in terms of this game, but the jokes are funny, the theme fun, and puns from other video games are all up to par. So if you are looking for something light go with this you should get some smiles and laughs from it.
I'm just going to tell that I love the game. It's not a complex game, it is simple yet wonderful. Sometimes you want a break from more serius games, and this is perfect. Worth every $

This game is a great filler for the casual gamer or can scratch an itch for some hardcore gamers. There is lots of management with your potatoes, each being able to level up in all aspects of the weaponmaking, exploring, merchanting, and researching proccesses. The starting potatoes the game gives you are plenty talented that hiring is not the forefront of your priorities, unlike other similar games (GameDev Story).   Like most games of this genre, you will spend some extra time getting your business up and running. I have a few hours logged and still enjoying the game. There is a balanced progression when it comes to unlocking new areas and weapons. The game does not lockout your progression if you stick to the quests given at the start, also there is no currency other than in-game $, so don't worry about the 'Mobile game pay to win' mentality about this game. Also, the need for purchasing crafting items goes out the window once you start exploring with 1-2 Taters, keeping your stock nice and full with materials, thus allowing you to keep crafting, exploring, researching, and selling.  Overall, I agree that the pricetag might be a bit much for some people. I bought this game knowing what I was getting into after reading the game's description, and I am not disappointed in the least. If $15 is too steep for you on this type of game, then hold off until it has a sale.

A very fun game. It is a mixture of Reccetear, and game dev tycoon. You own your own weapon shop, where you must manage your employees, to put them in the best possible locations to get the highest results! This game is exciting to the last second, and then, you can continue on. The story is pretty easy, there's never an opportunity for struggle or hardship, unlike other store owning games (reccetear). You must stay vigilant though, keep those swords grinding, and sell the perfect sword to the perfect customer!

Haven't played it for long because i was in rush, but what i have seen it's pretty fun. Forging the right weapon, finding its buyers and bringing your weaponsmith to a higher level. A lot of fun content, had few good laughs while playing, but man, i ll say just one thing for all these potatoe lovers... POTATO DOG. Simply brilliant, made my day. High recommendations for the game based on what i have seen so far. Will certainly spend more time playing in next few days as much as my busy workflow allows me to!
This game is super addictive! I really enjoy the art style and the music is really catchy! I definitely recommend this game to anyone, its fun for all ages!
Best freaking game I've bought in a long, long time. It's addicting, cute as hell, and made to be endless hours of dun. 10/10 would buy again!
Goofy and grindy shop management game. Lots of references and puns. Good for at least one run, maybe more if you self-impose rules or try for different strategies.

So the name sounds for the clinical insane and it seems like a laugh to play, and to be honest it is! But it’s not for the serious management or strategy gamer, I would class it more for the casual gamer. Someone who wants to jump into something that doesn't require too much brain power or concentration but you want to just grab a few minutes (or hours) of mouse clicking with a chuckle every so often. Would I recommend it? The answer is yes for those people who don't take games to seriously and want something to jump in an out of, I would have felt better paying a little less for it (maybe during a sale), but overall it’s been enjoyable thus far!
Extremley repetitive
Their reference game is on point. Prepare to be overwhelemed with potato puns

Super shallow game mechanics, was pretty disappointed. Luckily got it for 'free' in a games bundle, would have returned else. Selling this game at 15$, and it being so much more shallow than even comparable browser games, is a joke.
Kinda fun, kinda cute. A little bit repetitive. Fun for a short while.

I don't really recommend this game. Unless your a 6-1yrr old I doubt you'll get much entertainment from it. It seems it was designed for little kids, so, that might be why. But I thought it might be a decent crafting + economic sim. But it's not. The humor is just horrible. But again, to a kid it might actually be funny. Who knows?  But the point of review is to get an individuals perspective and mine is this game isn't worth $1 let alone the asking price.

I tried liking this game, but it's just way too boring/repetitive for PC- for mobile I can see it being more succesful, but at this moment I have no incentive to go back to this game  My long playtime on this is skewed, it is purely card farming

I was excited for this game as I loved Recettear. However, this game was simply too easy. You could almost just sit back and produce dozens of the same weapon, sell them to the same people over and over and become too big to fail. Stopped playing after however many hours it says on my profile. oh well.
Very good and addictive. Becomes slightly repetitive and easy in the last levels though. Overall very good game!

The game start out a little slow at the start.  After playing it for a some time it gets better. Would recommend other players to give this game a longer time. It slowly add more contents and interesting stuff like the pet dog as shown in the trailers. Good music and art style.  Didn't face the bug mentioned by others I think the developers resolved them quickly. Recommended to give the game a try as it is quite new and original.

It's cute and fun, but after losing 3 hours of play to a game over for being a couple $tarch short at payday time (admittedly my fault), it's not fun enough to make me want to replay that time. I'll probably never pick it up again.

It's difficult. At least for me, someone not familiar with simulation games. But i found the character extremely cute, which is why i bought this game. So alone for this reason i give a positive rate.

Cute little game.  So you start your little shop. You start crafting simple weapons at first. Trough exploration and research, you unlock new blueprints for weapons. You hire more avanced worker who can craft better, slowly building your 'dream team' of specialists. You gain experience and level them up. As you grow you move to bigger shops and buy more advanced tools and installations.   The game is very relaxing and it has some humor in form of references to other games and movies. You will craft weapons for some well known characters look-alike / sound-alike... From gandalf to Gordon from half life 2. It's a nice touch.  I pretty much played this game from start to finish in two days, two sittings... about 20 hours including some 4-5 hours of AFK time in there. There is not much replay value, since the game is about accumulation, gathering, and growth without any real tactics or strategy that would warrant another play. But that first run was fun, I would recommend you check this game.

What to say that hasn't already? its overall a fun game to play, in basic terms your a blacksmith aiming to be the best of the trade, making well, weapons, and then selling them, you have all sorts to pick and work from. Even the characters that come in, you might find quite familier, even comical in interaction, wont spoil anything, but really its worth giving a try, not many games run in this style, even the artwork is a cutesy style, there are even toddleresque voiceovers whicha re good for a few laughs to keep things from becoming too serious, everyone being a race of potatoes(tho they remind me of toes XD)
The infinite tutorial makes me sad... Like really sad.
Bribed a potato judge to win a contest in which I helped a brotato get lvl cap so he could kill some potatos... 10/10
loads of fun
I didn't feel like I did anything when I 'played' this game.

This game is addictive. My favourite part is the in-game cameos, which feature characters from other hit games. It's a refreshing step away from usual RPGs; no dungeons to crawl through and towns to explore, but retains its fantasy-esque feel by paying tribute to the familiar weapons of the RPG universe. Not meant to be a graphics-appealing kind of game, but I'm a huge sucker for cartoony-styles, so this game was right up my alley. I enjoy the level of thought I had to put into optimizing my gameplay in order to maximize my revenue and rewards. Furthermore, I don't have to deal with 'dailies' in this game, which seems to become more and more prevalent in other games similar to H.P.A.W.S.  Overall, probably the best game I've played in months.
Gets old fast.
So fun... wtf it's 5 in the morning...

Too repeditive with no gameplay diversity, played for 3 hours, got no gameplay diversity past the half hour mark, and then just repeated with no at all diversity. Worth about three dollars, then barely worth the time. It lokked so good too, and I love tychoon games. I would refer you to Game Dev Tycoon for a more diverse tycoon with more contet for 2/3 the price.

well i began playing holy potatoes a weapon shop yesterday.  basicly you play as a potato smith whos grandfather was a great potato smith, sadly he has passed away and now u have inherited his smithshop, with the help of the ''agent'' , which in actuallity not so much help. you will create various weapon types, and begin your adventure in selling of some fine wares to heroes.  over time u will gain the ablitiy to research new weapons to make, and even venture into the wild unknown to gather supplys, or u can stick to simpler weapons by buying ingredients from the shop.  best weapons tend to need items found only by exploring though.  there is 4 types of smiths that work together, intitally only 3 are unlocked, designer, metalwork, enchanter and last but not least craftsman.  over time you will gain a pet potato dog, the meaning behind the dog is he helps get the workers working harder when he stands in slots by them. and he may even help lower there stress. about stress and such, there are upgrades like a fire, a fan, and various other things which lower workers stress, or just give them boosts.  there are 4 base type stats for every weapon, attack,speed, accuracy, and magic. some heroes will prefer one over another, or two stats a main and a second stat.  you will find various charecters and side storys about charecters from past franchise games within this game, which i gotta say nice twist <3  oh and another thing to mention is the random events, u will sometimes be given a choice like. there is a plumber with a red cap in your backyard staring at the wild mushrooms, do u warn him not to eat them?  or do u join in and eat some yourself? results usualy vary randomly on each choice, so sometimes same choice may be incorrect.  oh and dont froget the awards time, i think its every year or few months ingame were 3 trophys, and 3 judges vote on best weapons, 3 catigories which may be the same or change, but 3rd is always most stats.  so to sum it up you become a smith, you get a team of workers and over time your able to hire and fire smiths and create even better weapons over time which u sell to the heroes. but also do be warned of the growing paychecks every month as your smiths dont work for free. which lots of comedy and twists in it, which overall great game if u enjoy management games <3   if this review is not helpful, please leave a comment as to why u feel that way so i may make changes if needed ^w^

This game gets repeatitive very quickly and once you get to the second world map it just gets worse. The game is fun for the first hour as you learn how things work, but past that point it gets dull ;-;
Super cute game and very well made.  Definitly worth playing & gifting it to a friend :)
I love this game. But it can get boring after awhile.

At first glance, it struck me as an interesting idea: playing as a shop owner, managing your shop, researching better weapons, etc. However, the actual execution of the game is extremely lacking. After about 2 hours of gameplay, everything is just a repetitive grind.  First off, all weapons from the same category has similar patterns of stat growths. For example, all Daggers have high speed and magic. Thus, there is a single 'Best Weapon' in any category, and if you've already had that researched, there's no real purpose in researching the weaker ones other than for completion.  Secondly, the research mechanic is totally boring. They could have made an interface allowing people to 'craft' certain weapons by combining relics, but instead they went for a no-depth waiting mechanic, where you just wait for your item to be done.  To add to that, the explore mechanic ruins the management aspect of the game. You never run out of materials anymore as long as you send your explorer out every month or so. There's no purpose in having shops around the world since your explorer gathers items for free. You end up completely drowning in materials that you don't really need.  Not to mention, some of the objectives require the player to gather a sum of money, and as soon as the player has that exact amount, the game takes it away from the player. One time, it left me completely broke that I wasn't able to pay my hired smiths on the payday.  All in all, the game had overcomplicated things that could have been simple (such as the general shop interface, the world events), and overly simplified things that could have been expanded and made interesting (such as the research, exploration, and general weapon-making mechanic). There are better games to spend your money on.
This Game Is Amazing,Kept Me Entertained For 7.7Hours And More to Come. It has a very in depth Micro Mangement Feel to it and it has very catchy BackGround Music.

I recommend this game vey much. I LOVED IT.                                                                 I don't wanna say this... but... it has a bad thing... :(  This game needs Steam Cloud for people like me who has a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ pc that crashes and you loose everything on the pc.
You're a potato making weapons and you can get a dog. What more needs to be said?
Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?! is a funny shop management and RPG game that is always making fun of pop culture 5/5 stars. Oh wait this game uses Letter grades soooo! IT'S AN S! For super amazing
This game is kinda boring. Feels more like an app than a PC game. Is this a port? Well either way, if you like app style games then this might be right up your ally! Just not wuite my cup of tea.

Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?! Is an odd game, the title itsef is absurd. With exclamations, and a question mark you can somewhat see where this game is going. It is a simplistic 'Management' game in which you order sentient potatoes to forge weapons for you, then you can sell them, as well as have the character explore to collect supplies, and enchantments. (Which allow for stat bonuses between the four attributes of the weapons:Accuracy, Speed, Damage, and Magic, Though they don't really have any affect besides how large of a payment you recieve.) The characters though rather limitedly written were rather amusing, the gameplay itself was pretty interesting until you find all of the weapons, in which case you are just grinding until you reach the unsatisfying end of the game. The game is full of pop culture references, and to me they were used to an amusing affect. However, humor is subjective, so some, maybe even many of you would hold contempt for the writing. They definitely could've flashed out the game more, it just seems rather skeletal as it is, It is not a bad game by any means, it just feels as if it's lacking a few key qualities.  But, I am not an expert, and preference itself is subjective. So I reccommend reading the various other reviews, both good and bad, and consider their points carefully. I honestly enjoyed this game, but it did feel hollow. A better story, better variation in the potato puns, maybe try to find a way to flesh out the mechanics of the game so you don't slump into monotany near the end, and maybe a more intuitive way to upgrade various aspects of your characters, and equipment.  Would I recommend this game? No. Is it terrible? By no means, It just needs to be fleshed out.

The game is alrightly done, the art style suits the game cause like gameplay its very simplistic if your a fan of clicking then waiting while your staff do stuff for you and you really dont have much input into the game this is your game.  The tags of simulation and management are over stated for this game its more like they originally planed for this game to be a mobile game and if it was a mobile game this would be forgiveable but for the price they are selling it at it is not worth the price.  The music is okay but after a while the banging of hammers and random sounds leave you with a headache.  The game is extremely repetative and will leave you after a hour going what is the point of continueing maybe it gets more exciting end of the game but early game is very much not grabbing any sort of attention.
It is almost the same as game dev tycoon but a little different it has to much to do in so little time.

Love the game but I think it is bugged well... now I do   Every time I go to load game it says agagagauuaga or whatever name it is then it has 999,999,999 money and 999,999 fame and I can't even load it it is in auto save slot and it won't go away and now it won't let me save the game. It also deleted allllll my previous saved games    THIS GAME IS AWESOME BUT SUCKS AT THE SAME TIME.... well now it does

It's entertaining enough, for one or two playthroughs. But the replay value is really lacking, especially when compared to other games of the shop simulation genre. I did enough playthroughs to get all of the achievements that weren't the 'make X number of weapons' kind, then deleted it.   The pop culture references and jokes are cute, but again, that's only entertaining enough for one playthrough. I don't find myself absolutely addicted the way I get with, say, Kairosoft games. There's no real depth or strategy here, as others have posted.  There are better management sims out there. Skip this one unless you get it on a steep sale or a Humble Bundle (pretty sure that's where I picked it up).
Never Thought I Would See The Day I Could Tell Kratos That He Missed Leg Day 10/10
Dont waste your time and money. After the latest update, im told all my saves are corrupted, and all my effort wasted. The developers are plainly careless and terrible.
sucks

Do not expect anything else than GameDev Tycoon, for the better and for the worse. It is based on a very similar system and the gameplay is the same; save you have smiths instead of developers, and therefore you enter the world of magic. Those who enjoyed the classic era tycoons, and deep enjoyable complex games which make you enter new, stunning worlds. So if you expect anything great, or deeply fun, turn away. And if you expect something original, run as fast as possible. After all, it is again a minigame, a flashgame. A good flashgame. But an expensive flashgame.
Super cute and a super relaxing gameplay.

Game is great!  The music is amazing, is quite funny and has great references.  I've only played for 2 hours, but that was in 2 sessions, one of them being only 30 minutes. It's really easy to get stuck and can't get away from the game.  Reminds of Game Dev Tycoon which is a plus aswell :)  10/10

Being a fan of time waster games like Game Dev Tycoon/Story or the Harvest Moon series I am already a fan of games like these. When I first saw the preview I thought it looked really good. I was not proven wrong. I played for about 2 hours today for the first time since I got it in October (I was busy with other things) and this game is really addicting. The puns are rather cute and ridiculous, but this definitely adds to the charm. While this game may not be for everyone if you like simulation games you may want to give this game a try.

This game is a pretty good game would give it a 7/10 or 8/10. I found myself chuckling quite a bit to the quirky statements made in the story as well as all the references to characters from other universes like Tony Starch for instance. This is purely a management type game. You build weapons and then sell them to adventures/heroes to make a profit, and repeat. The major downside to this game is that it gets very repetitive and can hit that pretty quickly. But with a pretty low price you should more than get your moneys worth.

Pretty good game, aside from the repititveness, it would be nice if the characters desiring the weapons would be split into sub categories by town when your selecting the weapon. Also have a loop feature for if you want to craft the same weapon over and over, same with gathering training.  Overall 7/10

10/10 would play again! Terrific little game with great art, intuitive controls, and relaxing music and sounds (in a blacksmith's no less!). Lots of depth and by the end you'll be pointing and clicking as much as and Starcraft without even realizing it cuz you're having too much fun. A blast to play and more importantly and game with heart and a genuine sense of humor.

This is one of the best games I have ever played!! I may not have many games downloaded on steam, but this is one of the best. I have over 500,000 fame and 5,000,000 $tarch. So many little details are added into this game just to make it feel more charming and better. The dog is cool, all the references to movies and games were pulled off beautifully. The ending was also pretty good, I wont spoil it though. I hope this game continues to get better and better. One thing I hope that is added is the ability to get every relic at the last stage. I have every weapon researched except the last throwing one :( I definitely recommend this game for anyone you plays games on steam.

Holy Potatoes A Wepon Shop?! is simple the most fun I've had in the last 6 months for sure. Being into management games, I've played quite a few, and not many come close to what this game offers. The art style is amazing to look at and humors you thew whole way through the expirience.   Very deep tactics to crafting the wepons and expanding your smith's capabilities.   The music never gets dull and fits in with the style very well.   It keeps you entertained and progresses you to keep that sense of improvement consistant.   However this game is not absolutely perfect. The game does not seem very long (I believe I am pretty much at the highest level for everything) and this is a problem with a $15 price tag.   Overall a great expirience would recommend picking up when on sale very enjoyable.     And screw the ♥♥♥♥ing ice machine the noise is makes gets really annoying. Please make that sound effect removable!
Great Game and highly addictive :)
a very addictive game but can feel like dajavew at times. Still....adictive....
fun and simple game, the downside is that you have to pay the workers and BOY the game ge's cruel as you progress
The kind of game you play for hours before you realize you've played for hours. In short, really good despite some non-gamebreaking flaws!
It's more challenging than I expected, but never dull.   This game is worth the cost.
you can make stuff  its good
Repetitive but ok I guess.

This is really simple game and i mean it in kinda negative way. It gets quickly repetitive and it isn't much challenging. The game takes place in interesting potato universe where you can find bunch of funny characters. But not everyone can enjoy that kind of potato humor.   So if you're looking for really good tycoon game, look somewhere else. If you're looking for simple funny game, for relaxing or maybe for kids, this is right potato for you.  I give this game 3 out of 5 potatoes.

Got this game in a bundle, was able to capture my attention and entertain with simple to learn mechanics, humor, a fun rpg style, and gaming references galore.   If you like the idea of a game that reminds you of a mobile resource management game without the microtransaction BS then this game may be for you.  Edit: I am an idiot and don't know the difference between a town name and the name of the region. A big thumbs up to the devs for responding to community feedback and allowing me to realize I had my head up my... well you get the point. Giving this game the thumbs up it deserves. Keep being awesome.
Wonderful and fun game!!  The art is cute and great. The gameplay is phenomenal. Great game if you like simulation games!!!. MUST TRY

An addictive tycoon type game where you are in charge of running a weapon shop and managing your smiths to build better and better weapons to sell to the regions heroes.  Very much like game dev story and it's relatives, but adds in a nice amount of humour and references from the fantasy and gaming worlds. Will keep you in the 'just one more weapon' cycle for a long time.
OMG I LOVE THE MUSIC. I CAN'T GET IT OUT OF MY HEAD.

I want to like it but it I hate having to send out my workers to buy, sell, research, and find items. It's a bad Kairosoft Games ripoff but I wish it was a good ripoff because I like Kairosoft's mechanics. This game would be more enoyable if the customers came to you, instead of the opposite. I give it a thumbs up but get it on sale.
great game! you can play for a decent amount of time! worth while
